head.title: Events: Architecture In Words and Drawings

hedline.hl1: Events: Architecture In Words and Drawings

block.p: Contemporary Architecture Wood Auditorium in Avery Hall, Columbia University, Broadway at 116th Street; (212) 854-3414.
Contemporary Architecture Wood Auditorium in Avery Hall, Columbia University, Broadway at 116th Street; (212) 854-3414.
A panel discussion on architecture in America from the 1960's to the present will be held tomorrow night, from 6:30 to 8. No charge.
About Buckminster Fuller Max Protetch, 560 Broadway, at Prince Street; (212) 966-5454.
Drawings, blueprints and photographs featuring the work of the architect and designer R. Buckminster Fuller are on view through Dec. 2. Open Tuesday through Saturday, 10 A.M. to 6 P.M. No charge.
Fuller Centennial Cathedral of St. John the Divine, Amsterdam Avenue at 112th Street; (212) 663-2133.
The cathedral will mark the centennial of R. Buckminster Fuller's birth tonight, starting at 8 P.M. Events include a reading from Fuller's works by the actress Irene Worth. No charge.
Skidmore, Owings & Merrill National Arts Club, 15 Gramercy Park South; (212) 475-3424.

Architectural and interior designs by the architectural firm Skidmore, Owings & Merrill will be on display through Wednesday. Works include Logan and Kennedy International airports and the New York Mercantile Exchange. Open Tuesday through Saturday, 10 A.M. to 6 P.M.; Sunday, 2 to 5 P.M. No charge. An Architect's Perspective New York School of Interior Design, 170 East 70th Street; (212) 472-1500, extension 10.
Ricardo Legorreta of the Mexico City firm Legorreta Arquitectos will talk about his work tomorrow, 6 to 8 P.M. Reservations suggested. No charge.
